docs.snippet: A man who fought in Vietnam and then delivered mail for decades should have been able to retire safely; he owned a house in Queens with a mortgage all but paid off. That latter fact, however, laid him low....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man who fought in Vietnam and then delivered mail for decades should have been able to retire safely; he owned a house in Queens with a mortgage all but paid off. That latter fact, however, laid him low.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column on Stanley Theodore of Springfield Gardens, Queens, Vietnam veteran and retired postal worker fighting for his home after falling behind on mortgage payments; Theodore shares story of how Countrywide refused to cash three late checks while he waited for his pension to kick in, and then convinced him to sign over his mortgage, falsely promising him that his debt would be resolved before initiating foreclosure proceedings.

headline.main: Veteran Wages a New Fight: For His Home
headline.print_headline: Veteran Wages a New Fight: For His Home

docs.snippet: The Internet has turned more Hamptonites into prospering landlords and left local officials busy trying to keep a cork on all the new activity, which can violate the law....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Internet has turned more Hamptonites into prospering landlords and left local officials busy trying to keep a cork on all the new activity, which can violate the law.
docs.abstract: Appraisal column; websites like Airbnb, HomeAway, VRBO and even Craigslist are reshaping seasonal rental market in the Hamptons, turning year-round homeowners into prospering landlords and leaving local officials scrambling to curtail flurry of activity that could be violation of local laws severely restricting short-term rentals.

headline.main: For Owners and Brokers, Web Rentals Upend the Hamptons Season
headline.print_headline: For Owners and Brokers, Internet Rentals Upend the Hamptons Season

docs.snippet: Two new science-fiction movies, “Earth to Echo” and “The Signal,” take different approaches to the question of what else might be out there....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two new science-fiction movies, “Earth to Echo” and “The Signal,” take different approaches to the question of what else might be out there.
docs.abstract: Dennis Overbye Out There column observes that science fiction movies Earth to Echo and The Signal, both of which have plots revolving around alien visitors, are similar in content but completely different in message and tone; notes continuing fascination with extraterrestrials and lingering questions about whether they exist.
